value.title: Exploring Microsoft Purview for data governance
value.excerpt: You've probably heard of Microsoft Purview somewhere. Buck Woody joins Patrick to highlight how Microsoft Purview can help you with data governance. From cataloging to lineage, Purview is a key component for your data strategy!  Connect with Buck: https://twitter.com/BuckWoodyMSFT https://www.linkedin.com/in/buckwoody/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/69PY3YzygNk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Exploring the Visio visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Want to explore locations with data? The Visio visual in Power BI helps you do just that! Patrick looks at how to set it up and help use your data to highlight areas within a Visio diagram.  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/visiosample  Documentation: https://support.microsoft.com/office/add-visio-visuals-to-power-bi-reports-4f09be62-f436-45c2-93b0-4a0f66b1f5a7

value.title: How do I get my Excel users to use Power BI???
value.excerpt: Lots of people use Excel and love it! But what about Power BI? Why not use both together? Patrick looks at how Excel users can take advantage of Power BI and may just start using that!  Start in Excel to connect to Power BI datasets https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/collaborate-share/service-connect-excel-power-bi-datasets

value.title: How do you even use VertiPaq Analyzer with Power BI???
value.excerpt: Not sure how to use VertiPaq Analyzer with Power BI to optimize your data model? Marco Russo joins Patrick to show you how!  Connect with Marco: https://twitter.com/marcorus Download VertiPaq Analyzer: https://www.sqlbi.com/tools/vertipaq-analyzer/  Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses

value.title: Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium
value.excerpt: In this video, Christian Wade joined Adam Saxton to discuss Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium. You can use Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium to take your dataset beyond 1GB and avoid failures such as timeouts.  Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium documentation - https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-premium-incremental-refresh

value.title: Install and configure Power BI Report Server (May 2017 Preview)
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at how to install and configure the May 2017 Preview of Power BI Report Server. Power BI Report Server has a new standalone install experience and this product allows for Power BI reports to be rendered in the web portal along with paginated reports. value.title: Is a parameter filtered in Power BI Paginated Reports???
value.excerpt: How do you know if a parameter was filtered in your Power BI Paginated Reports? Was a slicer used in the Power BI report that is using the Paginated visual? Adam shows you a way you can find out!  Create and use the paginated report visual https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/visuals/paginated-report-visual

value.title: Native Query: Be careful when using in Power BI
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at native query and why you should be careful when using it in Power BI. He looks at what native query is, what to consider when using it, and how to monitor what query folding, in Power Query, is or is not doing.  Guy in a Cube Courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT!

value.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop

This is great for when you are creating a report, and need to share it with a customer that may have a different name for the server
